title: Gurmehar's father was martyred while protecting the Amarnath Yatra

The political debate in India today has been centered around the posts put up by Delhi University student Gurmehar Kaur . Her two posts went viral and the same has elicited responses from the who is who in political circles. She is the daughter of a brave son of India, Captain Mandeep Singh . Captain Singh was martyred while providing security to the Amarnath Yatra. Delhi University student Gurmehar Kaur 
Captain Singh described by his colleagues as a dedicated and spirited young officer was part of the 4 Rashtriya Rifles. On August 6 1999, Captain Singh made the supreme sacrifice while fighting militants. The midnight attack took place in the Chak Nutnusa village in Jammu and Kashmir 's Kupwara district. 
Captain Singh was the commander of the company and the took the fight to the militants. Seven personnel too were martyred in the militant attack that took place at 1.15 am on August 6 1999. The militants were however beaten and the Yatra was defended. Captain Singh who led the company received a bullet injury and was declared dead on the spot. 
Gurmehar Kaur had created a storm with her post in which she said, " war killed her father, not Pakistan." She also posted that she is not scared of the ABVP and every student in India supports her. The post came following the ruckus at the DU last week.
